Thank you. I've begun "playing" with JUnit so I've already started 
on opti=
on 1. I'll see what I can do with option 2.

So far, whatever caused the Al=
lTests failures doesn't seem to be 
interfering with my tests. 

RK Henry

=
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> Robert,
> 
>=
 The JUnit self-tests make an attempt to execute JUnit on the 
command 
> l=
ine to make sure that the correct exit code is returned.  It 
appears 
> th=
at something in your configuration is causing all of these 
> command-line =
executions to fail.  This most likely is a conflict 
between 
> your Java c=
onfiguration and JUnit's self-test framework, and will 
likely 
> not preve=
nt you from using JUnit for your own tests. You have two 
options:
> 
> 1) =
Ignore the error and get started.
> 2) Help us out, by setting a breakpoint=
 at 
TextRunnerTest.execTest.  
> Figure out what command it's trying to ru=
n, and see if it works on 
a 
> separate command line.  This will help to p=
inpoint the problem.
> 
> Thanks,
> 
>     David Saff
>
